definitions.definition: Chiefly with a qualifying word : Any relation (especially a distant one) who is not a direct ancestor or descendant but part of a person 's extended family ; a kinsman or kinswoman .

subdefinitions.definition: Preceded by an ordinal number , as first , second , third , etc. : a person descended from a common ancestor by the same number of generations as another person.
When used without a qualifying word : the child of a person's parent 's brother (that is, an uncle ) or sister (an aunt ); a cousin-german , a first cousin .
examples: Although we were cousins , we grew up like sisters.

definitions.definition: A person of an ethnicity or nationality regarded as closely related to someone of another ethnicity or nationality.
Used as a term of address for someone whom one is close to; also, ( preceding a first name , sometimes capitalized as Cousin ) a title for such a person.
Used by a monarch to address another monarch, or a noble ; specifically ( British ) in commissions and writs by the Crown : used in this way to address a viscount or another peer of higher rank .
Something kindred or related to something else; a relative .

subdefinitions.definition: A female sexual partner who is not a person's wife ; specifically, a prostitute .
A person who is swindled ; a dupe .
A person who womanizes ; a seducer , a womanizer .

main_definition: Chiefly with a qualifying word : Any relation (especially a distant one) who is not a direct ancestor or descendant but part of a person 's extended family ; a kinsman or kinswoman .
secondary_definitions: ( chiefly in the plural ) A person of an ethnicity or nationality regarded as closely related to someone of another ethnicity or nationality.
Used as a term of address for someone whom one is close to; also, ( preceding a first name , sometimes capitalized as Cousin ) a title for such a person.
Used by a monarch to address another monarch, or a noble ; specifically ( British ) in commissions and writs by the Crown : used in this way to address a viscount or another peer of higher rank .
( figurative , also attributive ) Something kindred or related to something else; a relative .
